授業目的: This course introduces students to the academic study of Japanese religions from the perspectives of theory, history, and contemporary practice. By stressing the combination of analytical concepts, historical information, and anthropological observations, it encourages students to approach Japanese religions critically, comparatively, and in context.
到達目標: By taking this course, students will gain a general understanding of the main methods and theories of the study of Japanese religions as part of a broader inquiry into Japanese society past and present.
